Commentary: short of a length, straight, and he defends from the crease
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Gayle, no run

Commentary: fuller, straight, and a bit of swing back into Gayle, who brings his broad bat down to push this towards mid on and pick up an easy single
full ball, outside off, and he crunches a cover drive, but straight to the man at short cover
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Rahul, no run

Commentary: length, outside off, and he plays this towards point. There's a shy at the striker's end as they go through for a quick single. A direct hit could have been interesting...
full ball, angles across him, and he pushes this towards point. Just eased into it, and it was four once it beat the in-field
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Gayle, FOUR runs

Commentary: full ball, and a bit of width, and he gets this one through covers comfortably
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Gayle, FOUR runs

Commentary: slower ball, outside off, and he edges this, but along the ground as it creeps down towards Karthik
straighter ball, and he pushes this towards midwicket and picks up a quick single
length, straight, and he drives this back to the bowler
a little short of a length, and he pushes this through covers. Piyush Chawla goes running behind it and saves the boundary, but this looks like a good batting surface today
slower ball, outside off, and he cuts this in the air, but it lands short of Shubman Gill at point
full ball, and he defends this back towards the bowler
short, outside off, and he punches this towards cover
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Rahul, no run

Commentary: short, and a bit of width, and Rahul looks to force this through the off side. Hits it hard on to the ground, though
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Rahul, no run

Commentary: the first wicket comes through! Slower ball, straight, and Rahul looks to chip this through midwicket. Bails out at the last moment, and ends up going straight towards mid on. Chris Lynn, with a microphone on him as he speaks to the broadcasters, runs across over his right shoulder and takes a good catch
Dismissal_text: KL Rahul c Lynn b Sandeep Warrier 2 (14m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 28.57

Commentary: short, and he cuts this past point, and with third man inside the circle, that was always going to be four
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Agarwal, FOUR runs

Commentary: straight ball, strays on to the pads a bit and he flicks this towards backward square leg
short, swift and angles into him, as he flicks this away towards midwicket and trods through for a single
tosses this up around off stump, and Gayle eases into a drive towards extra cover
tosses this up, it turns into him, and he has to defend this back to Narine
straighter one, takes the outside edge as he shapes to flick, and it pops up towards cover. They hurry through for a quick single
angles across Gayle, pitching on leg stump, and he defends this back down the wicket
down the leg side, but fired in quicker, and it hits his pads as he shapes to flick
short, and he goes back and punches this towards deep midwicket

short, and he has got his man this time! The trap was set for Gayle, and he falls into it. Short ball, angles across him, and he looks to scoop this towards deep backward square leg, but that's where Shubman Gill is stationed, and he gleefully accepts this. Young Warrier has removed both of Kings XI Punjab's top-performing batsmen this season!
Dismissal_text: CH Gayle c Shubman Gill b Sandeep Warrier 14 (23m 14b 2x4 0x6) SR: 100.00

Commentary: length ball, angles across him a bit, and Pooran has to defend this
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Pooran, no run

Commentary: short, angles across him at 140kph, and Pooran lets this pass
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Pooran, no run

Commentary: short, angles across, and he punches this towards point, where Rinku Singh fields
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Pooran, no run

Commentary: short, and this time he rocks back and swings this away towards deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Pooran, FOUR runs

Commentary: fuller ball, towards the pads and he can force this off his pads towards long leg. Will pick up two comfortably
slower ball, outside off, and he plays a slightly airy shot through covers. The man at deep backward point will get around to it to limit the scoring to two
angles into him, and he plays it with a dead bat towards point and calls his partner through for one
slower ball, slants it into the pads, and he can flick this away towards deep backward square leg
fuller ball, and he looks to go towards long on. Bat turns in his hand a bit and it skews away towards deep midwicket. Will pick up two
short, and he latches on to this one easily. Goes over midwicket, and sends it deep into the stands. Was a slower ball, and he picked it early!
fuller ball, and he drives it towards covers
full ball, on the pads, and he whips it off his pads towards deep backward square leg
short ball, and he latches on to this and biffs this straight over long off. Really well timed shot
full, wide and he has a swing, and misses
short, and he looks to hook this. Gets an under edge, that carries it to the left of Karthik, and it runs away for four through third man. Lucky!
short, angles away from him, and he will have to re-bowl this. Pooran lets this pass
short, angles away from him, and he lets this pass. Wasn't too far from being a wide, but Pooran chose to let this pass
fuller ball, and he drives this down towards long off
tossed up, and he drills this straight back over the bowler, and way over long off. What a welcome for the leggie!
angles across him, and he plays this away towards backward point
wrong 'un, and he goes back and flicks this towards deep midwicket
short, and he goes back and cuts this away towards backward point. Attempt by Rana to keep it in play after running around from sweeper cover, but it goes for four
goes back to cut a short ball, and it beats the man at point. Should have been a dot, but they get a single as the man misfields
goes back to punch the ball away towards square leg
angles one into the pads, and he flicks it away towards long leg
fuller ball, angles across him, and he goes back to punch this towards short cover
length, turns across him, and he goes back and punches this towards deep midwicket. Perfect weight on it to force Narine to chase the ball, and still pick up two easily
flatter, faster, and he looks to flick this ball on his pads, but it thuds into the pads before he brings his bat down
presses forward and nudges a length ball towards square leg
tossed up, and he pushes this down towards deep midwicket
tossed up, angles into him and holds its line, and Agarwal goes back to defend this
tossed up, and he has hammered this back over the bowler's head. Aerial, but a bounce before it hits the fence behind the bowler
tosses this up, on the pads, and he flogs this down to long on
length, and he punches this off the crease, but cannot beat short cover
short, and he goes back and sends this about 15 rows back in the long leg region
wrong 'un, and he drives it back to the bowler
length and skidding at middle stump, looks to stab through the covers, gets an inside edge to short fine
shot! A clean, straight swing. He loves hitting spinners over their heads. Gets to the pitch of this and drills it straight from an off stump line
length outside off, on one knee as he drags this to deep midwicket
short and just outside off, cut straight to backward point

golden arm Rana puts another one in his book! Oh boy. Short ball, proper log-hop at an off stump line. Gets deep in the crease and looks to pull this over midwicket. But for one, this ground has big square boundaries, and two, he's lost his shape as this comes on a little slower than he expects. Dragged straight to the fielder. What an ordinary end to a stunning innings
Dismissal_text: N Pooran c Sandeep Warrier b Rana 48 (32m 27b 3x4 4x6) SR: 177.77

Commentary: length on middle stump, allows it to skid on and punches to long-on
full on off stump, leans in and drives to long-off
short of a length at leg stump, delicately pushed into the vacant midwicket region
full outside off, uses his wrists to get this drive wide of long-off
length at off stump, tapped through point on the rise
short of a length and turning in at off stump, gets deep in the crease and clips to long-on
length ball skidding in at middle stump, plants the front leg across and pokes out to long-on
short of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper cover's left
short of a length just outside off, pulled down to long-on
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Mandeep Singh, 1 run

Commentary: full on off stump, check-drive down to long-off
<b>deft!</b? Gets leg side of this length ball coming in at him, gets low, and opens the face late to slice this between keeper and short third
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Mandeep Singh, FOUR runs

Commentary: short of a length at middle stump, pulled to deep square
Commentary_short: Sandeep Warrier to Mandeep Singh, 1 run

Commentary: length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length and cramping him with turn into middle stump. Check-punch to extra cover
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket

run out sent upstairs. Is that a direct hit? Mayank diving full length at the non-strikers. No it's not direct hit, Narine's got his hands in a mess but he's got enough hand on the ball as it hits the stumps before his follow through takes the rest of it. Agarwal is gone. It was a full ball outside off, flicked between long-on and deep midwicket and the throw was right on top of the stumps. Agarwal has thrown away yet another IPL start
Commentary_short: Narine to Mandeep Singh, 1 run, OUT

Commentary: full on leg stump, flicked uppishly to deep midwicket's right
length outside off, driven to long-off
length at off stump, gets forward and jabs with soft hands towards long-on
full on middle stump, whipped down to long-on
short of a length just outside off, chopped to point's right
short of a length and skidding on at off stump. Backs away to pull, mistimes it down the pitch
short of a length at off stump, pulled to long-on's left

pulled over the bowler! Stunning shot. Short of a length and cramping him at the body. He gets deep in the crease but there's too much pace for him to go into the leg side with this. So he stays put and hammers it straight over Chawla
Commentary_short: Chawla to Mandeep Singh, SIX runs

Commentary: length on off stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
short of a length and skidding on too quickly for him to get this pull away. Mistimed bunt into the leg side
short of a length on off stump, flicked to deep midwicket
bouncer. Follows him as he shuffles early and forces him to get out of the way
full and just outside off, stays still this time, allows it to arrive in his swinging zone and belts it past mid-off
yorker at leg stump, jammed into the leg side
slower ball at leg stump, backs away to whip it. Taps it into the off stump because he's cramped
length on leg stump, nudged to short fine's left

smokes it! Uffff that is proper connection. Stepped out and was nowhere near the pitch of this short of a length middle stump offbreak. Doesn't matter. Stays composed behind the line and swings it 93 metres in the direction of wide long-on
full on middle stump, driven inside-out, uppishly to long-off's right

dropped! Rinku Singh at long-on! He's been their best fielder this second half of the tournament but has put down a complete sitter. Full ball on middle stump, looks for the slog but this time it rips away quick. He slices it. rinku is under it, has time. But it pops out
length on leg stump, flicked into the square leg region
to Rinku's left at long-on. Curran digs the dagger deeper. Length at middle, clears the front leg and heaves. One bounce and over the line as two fielders look to converge on it
yorker at off stump, exposes his stumps and jams it through cover
slower short ball at middle stump, pulls into the floor, out to deep square

held at extra cover. Gurney with the offcutter. Short of a length in the corridor. Makes room and tries to slap it over mid-off. Decent plan. But a better one from Gurney. No pace on it, gets it off the toe-end. Uthappa pedals backwards and takes it just past the edge of the circle
Dismissal_text: Mandeep Singh c Uthappa b Gurney 25 (35m 17b 1x4 1x6) SR: 147.05

Commentary: full outside off, slugged down to long-on off the inside half
beaten on the pull. Slower ball, short and skidding into his body. Skids under his bat and clears the stumps
Commentary_short: Gurney to R Ashwin, no run

Commentary: length and in at leg stump. Looks to flick, cops it on the back leg and gets a single pitch side on the off side
Commentary_short: Gurney to R Ashwin, 1 leg bye

Commentary: dragged on! Another offcutter does it for KKR. This is at a length outside off. Ashwin splits his legs and looks to carve this but the under-edge gets it into the stumps
length at leg stump, looks to flick and gets a deflection to third man off the front pad
oh smart. Expects the slower ball dug into the pitch. Walks into the off side - does it late. Russell can't adjust. His slower ball in the corridor is slapped to the fine leg boundary
smart again! Curran has figured batting out tonight, for sure. Now he stays deep in the crease, waits for the full one. It arrives and he's in position to club it over the bowler
slower short ball outside off, looks to pull, gets it off the toe-end to long-on
bouncer. Looks to hook but is too slow on it. Sails through to Karthik
yorker, regular pace, at middle stump. Whips across this and gets it to deep square's right

full and wide outside off this time. Steps into the off side and looks to slog this. Off the thick inside edge to deep square's right. Comes back for the second, puts in a slide, and survives the run-out call

crunched over extra cover! Gurney switches it up from a plan that seemed to be working. And he bowls an overpitched ball with a lot of width outside off. Curran camps in the crease and drills this on the bounce into the advertising boards
91 metres! What. An. Innings. Slower ball from Gurney and overpitched again. Curran is all over him. Waits on it to loop down and spanks it far over the long-on boundary

fifty! There it is again, Curran's unreal calm and wisdom. He's so young, and so is his career, but he just seems to be in full control of these situations. Gets his weight into the off side, gets behind the line and ramps this full ball fine

and finishes with four as well! Gurney has missed the yorker every time this over, but you've got to believe Curran has done that to him. He's basically made him bowl wherever he wants it. This is overpitched and at the stumps. He shuffles into the off side again and drags this to the long leg boundary
length, outisde off, and he gets behind the line and defends this
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: short, and he cuts this hard, but it is stopped by Rahul at point, and with the help of M Ashwin, they keep the scoring down to just one
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: short, and he goes up on his toes and punches this towards sweeper cover, who is stationed by the fence
length, jags into him, and he looks to flick this. Gets an inside edge on to the pads, which stops Shami mid-appeal, and it runs away towards square leg
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: length, swings into him, and he gets behind the line to defend
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Lynn, no run

Commentary: length, outside off, and he looks to drive, but hits it hard into the ground. Shami fields on his follow-through
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Lynn, no run

Commentary: length, and he angles it across Gill, who defends
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: back of a length, angles across him at 135kph, and he punches this towards short cover
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: slower ball, angles across him, and he drives this towards mid on. A bit to the right of the fielder there, and that allows them to get through for a single
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: length, straight, and he plays this towards square leg, and immediately calls Gill through for two. Excellent running!
down the wicket, and whacks this over midwicket. Well struck! Seemed to have pre-meditated it a touch, and Arshdeep fed him the short ball he was anticipating. Not fast enough, I'm afraid...
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Lynn, SIX runs

Commentary: length, and he plays an uppish drive wide of R Ashwin at mid off. Easy single to retain strike
length, a bit of width, and he slashes this away towards backward point
full ball, and Gill digs it out, but cannot beat M Ashwin at point
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: length, angles into him, and he plays a sumptuous drive through midwicket. Gorgeous shot as he eased it to the left of midwicket, and to the right of the man at mid on
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball, and he presses forward to punch this towards midwicket. Plays it gently enough to pick up a single
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: fuller ball, and he punches this hard down the ground. It bounces off the ground over Shami, but R Ashwin does well at mid off to get across to stop it and keep it down to one
short, and he slaps this hard back towards mid off, but it travels quickly to the Kings XI captain. No possibility of getting any runs here
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: fuller ball, and he looks to go down the ground. Gets an inside edge on to his leg, and it lands right at his feet
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Lynn, no run

Commentary: raw power! Makes room, and blasts a length ball angled across him through covers. It was more brute force, but importantly found the gap between mid off and cover
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Lynn, FOUR runs

Commentary: full ball, and drilled down the ground past mid off
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Lynn, FOUR runs

Commentary: short ball, and he gets this away towards fine leg. Not off the middle, but enough to beat Nicholas Pooran behind the wicket, as he desperately dives away to his left
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Lynn, FOUR runs

Commentary: slower ball, and he was looking to go hard between midwicket and backward square leg, but missed on contact. A touch off his body takes it towards short third man
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Lynn, 1 leg bye

Commentary: full ball, and he plays another attractive straight drive. Misfield from mid on, and that allows the batsmen to come back for the second
Commentary_short: Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 2 runs

Commentary: tosses this up outside off, and Lynn looks to go down the ground. Outside edge carries it past short third man
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Lynn, FOUR runs

Commentary: carrom ball, angles into his pads and he tries to drag this through the leg side, but cannot make contact
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Lynn, no run

Commentary: backs away, and picks up a carrom ball and goes inside out. Powerful, as he sends it deep over long off
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Lynn, SIX runs

Commentary: fuller ball, and he gets an inside edge on to his boot. It lands short of the bowler
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Lynn, no run

Commentary: tosses this up outside off, and he looks to go down the ground. Outside edge again, and it flies off towards short third man, but lands short
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Lynn, no run

Commentary: full toss, on the pads, and he whips this away towards deep midwicket. Will pick up two, as the sweeper has some work to do there
starts with a ball angling across him, and he helps it down to fine leg for four. Terrific timing, and placement to get it really fine
Commentary_short: Tye to Shubman Gill, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball, angles into him, and he defends this towards point
Commentary_short: Tye to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: length, and he punches this towards backward point
short, and he has got this away towards long leg. Not off the middle, but good enough to carry over the fielder stationed at the fence there
full ball, and he wants to go down the ground, but gets an inner edge, and it runs away towards fine leg for four

short, and he has top-edged this. It goes up, and Tye picks up the return catch! Could this be a turning point of sorts? This over had already produced 15, but Lynn wanted to maximise the last ball of the Powerplay, and paid the price in the process
Dismissal_text: CA Lynn c & b Tye 46 (28m 22b 5x4 3x6) SR: 209.09

Commentary: length, turns into him after pitching on leg, and he goes back and eases this towards deep midwicket
length, and he punches this towards sweeper cover. A half-stop at covers results in a deflection, and they can pick up two
Commentary_short: M Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 2 runs

Commentary: tossed up, angled in, and he plays this with the tide towards deep midwicket
Commentary_short: M Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: length, and he goes back and eases this to the right of point
tossed up, straight, and he punches this down to long on
Commentary_short: M Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: length, and he punches this down to long on
turns into him and he goes back and punches this towards deep midwicket
length, outside off, and he pushes this towards long off
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: length, and he goes back to play this towards point. Cannot get a run
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Uthappa, no run

Commentary: wide of the crease, angles into him, and Uthappa tries to get a reverse whip going. Gets an inside edge on towards short cover
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Uthappa, no run

Commentary: short, and wide, and he drives this towards sweeper cover
flicks a length ball towards deep midwicket
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: full ball, and he squirts it away towards fine leg
Commentary_short: M Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: tossed up, on the pads, and he hits this towards deep midwicket. The man at long on, KL Rahul, gets to it, and misfields. Oh dear. Gets nutmegged by the ball!
Commentary_short: M Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR runs

Commentary: uses his feet to get to a length ball, and lofts this straight over the bowler, and all the way for six over long off. Beautiful from Uthappa!
Commentary_short: M Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX runs

Commentary: length, zippy ball, and he goes back and plays a cut, very late, off the stumps virtually, and pierces the gap between point and short third man. Class!
Commentary_short: M Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR runs

Commentary: leg break, fired towards the pads, and he goes back and whips this away towards long leg
flicks a length ball towards deep midwicket
Commentary_short: M Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: angles into him, and he whips this off his pads towards backward square leg
slower ball, outside off, and he dabs this towards short third man and they go through for a comfortable single to Chris Gayle stationed there
length, and he punches this. Terrific placement again, and it gives mid off no chance
Commentary_short: Curran to Shubman Gill, FOUR runs

Commentary: length, and he punches it to R Ashwin at extra cover
Commentary_short: Curran to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: short, wide, and he punches this towards point, but gets it off the toe-end of the bat
Commentary_short: Curran to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: short, and he whips this away towards deep midwicket. Rahul fumbles a touch and that allows them to come back for two
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
length and following the batsman down leg. Backs away and punches to long-off
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: picks out long-off accurately. Uthappa checks his shot and is taken about ten yards inside the fence. Length ball cutting away in the corridor. Has room, makes more. But for some reason, doesn't swing hard through the line. Lobs it to Agarwal
Dismissal_text: RV Uthappa c Agarwal b R Ashwin 22 (19m 14b 2x4 1x6) SR: 157.14

Commentary: full carrom ball at middle stump. Defended off the outside half of the bat...and through the extra cover fielder. Ashwin can't believe it
full and just outside off, driven straight to extra cover
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: tossed up down leg side, whipped out to deep backward square
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: full and in at middle stump, leans in for the flick to deep midwicket
length ball down leg side, left alone
slower ball at leg stump. Looks to offer the full face and defend. Gets an inside edge to the keeper's left. Throw goes in at the non-striker's end and misses as Russell is ambling in
length and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
slower ball, dropped very short. Sits up nicely and he spreads his arms to slaughter this. Into the point boundary
short.  And just under the head. Makes Russell duck
appeal for catch behind but not out. Short and very wide outside off. Looks for that big chop through point again but is beaten
sweeeet. That Gill elegance. Down the pitch, not to the pitch of the ball, but he has long levers. Stretches his arms and hits through the line to lift this over long-on
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, SIX runs

Commentary: length outside off, chopped to extra cover's left
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: clears deep backward square! Poor ball. Stopped in his run up and bowled a length ball down leg side. Gill gets on one knee and sweeps deliberately over
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, SIX runs

Commentary: length outside off, under-edged poke into the off side
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: very wide. Once again, tries to switch his run-up. Loses control of it entirely
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 wide

Commentary: fifty. Silken late cut. Short of a length and wide outside off. Waits on it and just chops it to short third's right
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, FOUR runs

Commentary: length on leg stump, flicked into the midwicket region
Commentary_short: R Ashwin to Shubman Gill, 1 run

Commentary: length on leg stump, punched on the rise to long-on
full and in at leg stump. Backs away and slogs. Off the inside part of the toe-end. Long-on cleans up to his right
short and down leg side. Russell jumps into the off side to let it go
see ya! Here we go. Attempted yorker turns into a full toss on leg stump. Russell gets the front leg into the leg side, about a yard. Then he carts this over midwicket, about a billion yards
bouncer. Dug in too short. Left alone
full and wide outside off. Chucks his hands at this and is beaten
bouncer at an off stump line. Ducks under it

dropped! And he might have tipped it into the boundary padding too! Mayank at long-off. Full ball outside off, gets low and drills it flat. He's inside by quite a bit and gets his hands on this, but it floats and lands on the padding. Oh boy
length at leg stump, nudged down to fine leg with the angle
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, 1 run
Mohammed Shami to Russell, no run

Commentary: whack. A word invented precisely for when this man stretches his arms at a length ball wide outside off. Fizzes past extra cover
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Russell, FOUR runs

Commentary: short and in at the body. Backs away for the cut and is beaten
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Russell, no run

Commentary: taken at deep square! Short and into the body once again. Russell finally connects on the pull. But it's not ideal connection. Slices it. Big ground. And he won't clear it
Dismissal_text: AD Russell c Tye b Mohammed Shami 24 (23m 14b 2x4 2x6) SR: 171.42

Commentary: yorker at leg stump, looks to flick, cops it on the pad. Short fine cleans up
Commentary_short: Mohammed Shami to Shubman Gill, 1 leg bye

Commentary: length outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
slower ball at a length on off stump, dragged out to deep square
full and in at leg stump. Flicked to deep square
slower ball short and wide outside off. Under-edge on the cut to point
Commentary_short: Curran to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: slower short ball wide outside off, looks to cut and is beaten
Commentary_short: Curran to Shubman Gill, no run

Commentary: length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length on leg stump, looks to flick, gets it into the leg side via the thigh guard
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's left
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short-arm whip. Lovely. Length and climbing up at the body. Stays behind the line and deposits this between deep midwicket and long-on
Commentary_short: Tye to Shubman Gill, FOUR runs

Commentary: length at middle stump, punched to long-on
slower ball at a length on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
full at off stump, driven down to long-on
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Pulled to long-on
off the outside edge but there might have been intent to do exactly that from Karthik. Yorker length just outside off, jams the bat down on it and past the keeper
bouncer just outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, cut to third man's right
clears square leg! Short ball at leg stump, angled into him and he uses the angle to pump this over the fielder
seals the win with two overs to spare! Full and into the pads. Stays still and whips at it. Looks like a slight inside edge onto pad before it sprints to the fine boundary
